wordpressWpDailyReads.title: Daily Reads 7/10/2019
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Hi, everyone. It’s summertime, and as much as we like to focus on our next vacation, don’t forget to consider ways you can be saving this summer with our featured article on 6 tips for using tax-favored savings accounts. Recent news in real estate indicates the housing market is cooling after an intensive demand period. For anyone thinking about retirement, consider these 5 worst and best states when planning the next chapter of your life. Kanye might be best known for his musical accomplishments, but his Yeezy shoe line has turned out to be a successful business venture for the artist. And news out of the automotive industry shows that automakers are rolling out new models of crossovers and sport-utility vehicles, which risks cutting into profits in years ahead.

 

PERSONAL FINANCE

6 summertime uses for this tax-favored savings account

Before you head to the beach, use this tax-advantaged account to stock up on summer necessities.

 

REAL ESTATE

The housing market is about to shift in a bad way for buyers

Competition in the housing market finally began to cool this year, as listings multiplied and price gains moderated. Bidding wars became less frequent and spring sales perked up a bit. Well, forget that. The heat is on yet again.

 

RETIREMENT

Here are the 5 best and 5 worst states for retirement

From affordability and mobility to community and culture, there’s a range of factors those approaching their golden years need to take into consideration when deciding whether to retire in place or put down roots in greener — and less stressful — pastures.

 

BUSINESS

Kanye’s Second Coming: Inside The Billion-Dollar Yeezy Empire

Kanye might be best known for his musical accomplishments, but his Yeezy shoe line, which he launched with Nike in 2009 has turned out to be a successful business venture for the artist.

 

AUTO INDUSTRY

Suvs Are Bumper To Bumper On Dealer Lots With More On The Way

Auto makers are rolling out new models of crossovers and sport-utility vehicles, which risks cutting into profits in years ahead
